title: Very good movie
review: This movie is just what i want, and i had a great time watching it.

title: Creepy and Vague
review: I really appreciate the idea of this movie. It wants to make a horror movie that is slow and creepy with vague illusions to things without having to hammer them home to the audience.On the flip side of that it can be too slow. Sometimes it feels like there is too much dead air in between the plot. It doesn't really work to build tension it just shows them preforming normal tasks.It's a marvel to look at and really has a amazing fee while watching it. It's creepy and weird.It does sort of get a little tangled up in its self by the end and becomes a little bit isolating because it is known back and forward by the writer but the audience doesn't have that privilege which is why I think it would benefit from more than one watch.

title: wouldst thow speaketh up
review: Firstly you can't understand 90% of the words spoken. This really hinders the enjoyment as you're adjusting the volume up and down like a seesaw. The sound effects are at a 10 volume and the dialog is at a 5 for most of the time. Add to this the old English speaky speak and you have no idea what is being said. Things progress at a snails pace and in the very final scene when it looks like there is finally some action they roll the credits. It's less a horror and more an uneasy movie. The real horror is how puritanical they are and the absurd nature of their thinking. Rating out of 10 starts is hard. On the one hand you can see they really made it how they wanted and did it well. On the other hand as a piece of entertainment it's a bit like watching lawn bowls. It's got to be at least a 3 or 4, maybe a 5 or 6 depending on your view. It's certainly not a 10 and this talk of it being "the quintessential 21st century horror movie" is just laughable. Stuff it, to me it's a 3 at most.

title: Worst Puritans Evaaaarrr!
review: I found this to be pretty good overall, and totally rewatchable over time, especially because that helped make more sense of some of the darker, more ominous visuals (there were things I missed on the first watch), and to develop more empathy for the main character. Understanding the dialogue was not really a problem, IMO - it's not Shakespearean or anything. (Interpreting their twisted, tainted, opinionated logic was another thing.)The acting is very good. The family dynamics can be a challenging watch at times, but the idea that they're very different from any era should be dismissed. And, they're all sinners - Every One of Them, From Birth! Hahaha.Also, if they're gonna call you a sinner without actual facts, and banish or kill you for nothing, you might as well float off (naked?) to become a VVitch after the devil gets rid of them all for you.

title: Not for horror fans, for arthouse indie peeps
review: Excellent. Very slowly yet effectively conveys sexual politics or "the witch" era. Acting is excellent, direction as well. Really only for psycho drama fans, not horror. I loved it. Bonus points for Black Phillip, he is a true national treasure and should have received an Oscar for Best Supporting Goat in a Dramatic Role.

title: Unsatisfactory Stories
review: In the introduction of the film, we see that the father, the leader of the family, was expelled from the church on the grounds that he went astray from the path of God. Later, this family tries to survive by establishing a farm away from everyone. The first break in the story takes place here. Sam, the youngest son, is together with his older sister, Thomasin, in the clearing near the forest, while Sam suddenly disappears and is later killed by a witch.Caleb then gets lost in the forest and reaches the witch's house. The biggest witch here is given a very short space. The events that took place up to Caleb's arrival is another point where the story is interrupted. In this part, what the witch did to Caleb is completely enigmatic.We can understand the foundations of the story with William praying to god before he died. But we can't see any scene from the starting point of this. I was hoping for this part to be covered in more detail.In terms of camera and lighting, lighting and shooting angles were used one click above average. My biggest complaint in general of dark-themed horror movies is the darker scenes than they should be. So we need to see it to feel fear and tension. In some movies we just look at a dark screen and the main element that makes us fear or tense is the music. Not like that in this movie. Therefore, 8/10 points would be sufficient for the technical part of this film.

title: Outstandingly BORING
review:
What a waste of time .
As if the language depicted of the 17th century wasn't enough to irritate the s**t out of us in expectation of some horror which happened and passed without even showing a clear image , the title Witch is a mere attraction to lure people like us , should have read folktale first ...
Please give it a miss

title: That's no horror movie, honestly.
review: It's just a story of a family haunted by a witch! Movie scenes were so incoherently captured. Only the background music was up to the mark. You can watch it but don't anything! THAT'S NO HORROR MOVIE. Also keep in mind, this is a movie with a plodding storyline

title: Good period horror drama
review: For an hour and a half it is a great watch. Acting is good, cinematography is good, plot is good, sets are good, speach is good. This movie is just a good movie.It is a bit slower than I expected and darker, but I actually enjoyed slower pace as I always expected something and that kept me on my toes.Definitely a movie for you if you like witches, past time, paganism, folklore, Satanism and similar topics.

title: A masterstroke of horror, and cinema at large
review: We've seen many movies before about unseen terrors and mounting ill omens befalling a family. But not like this.We can talk about the blood and gore. We can talk about the obvious supernatural elements that go beyond reality as it's known in-universe. We can talk about the dark, depressive, disturbing atmosphere, suspense, and mystery that only deepens and grows as the film progresses. We can talk about the acutely shocking moments, presented in a deliberately understated way, that in other pictures would get all the focus of the camera.These are all reasons why 'The witch' is horror, but still only scratch the surface of what makes it so gripping, and such an essential film to watch.'The witch' fully embraces and embodies tropes of horror that most movies can only claim to dabble in: accusations of witchcraft, creepy behavior from children, hallucinations belying more horrid circumstances, exposure to Satanist worship, and more. Many movies play in this space, and surely do it well, but none immediately come to mind that actualize these ideas of the horror genre so concretely.Even still - the narrative is truly only part of the appeal here. A great deal of labor and love went into crafting a picture as period-accurate as it could be. From the meticulous construction of the family's domicile to the weave of their clothing, from the purposeful isolation of the setting to the lighting in each scene - writer and director Robert Eggers is to be applauded for overseeing a production so heavily detailed, to the extent that I again find myself unable to name an immediate comparison. A rarity in the horror genre, above all.Furthermore - it's one thing to hold a casting call in England to bolster authenticity, but the accents and manner of speaking of the early 17th century are a far cry from speech readily recognizable almost 400 years later. There's no shame in turning on subtitles here, as devotion to historical accuracy extends so completely to even the script that the dialogue can sometimes be difficult to discern without them. The cast is outstanding as they bring this tale to life, with even the grammar of another era playing heavily into their roles. All perform admirably, but very special mention must be made of Ralph Ineson, portraying the deeply religious and stubborn father William - and Anya Taylor-Joy, in the part of the bewildered, put-upon teenage protagonist, Thomasin. 'The witch' marked only the film debut of Taylor-Joy, and one would hope that she has many great things coming to her, because she is phenomenal.There's something to be said for the way these characters are presented to us. We readily sympathize with Thomasin, a young girl who is trying to define herself while suffering the scorn of her parents in the circumstances they find themselves in. We sympathize less immediately with the twins that torment their older sister, or with the strict father whose stubbornness and religious devotion upholds an imposing moral view that would essentially demand the damnation of anyone watching the film. Yet even as we identify most with Thomasin, as events escalate and tragedy and hardship befall the family, it's difficult not to still feel crestfallen with each portent they suffer.All of this only makes the ending even more tremendous. The conclusion of 'The witch' is hands down one of my favorite endings to any movie I've seen, matched only by John Carpenter's 'The thing' (though there are many runners-up). The way the ending conveys its atmosphere, the way it toys with the suspense that's been building, and the very denouement of the narrative all mesh into a genuinely perfect capstone for such an incredible film.'The witch' isn't for everyone, not by a longshot. Between the blood and gore, general violence, nudity, and overall themes, someone who doesn't enjoy horror films isn't likely to find favor here, either. Yet the movie is so very carefully, lovingly made, in every possible way, whether one is dissecting the production, the screenplay, the acting, or the narrative generally. Despite belonging squarely in the horror genre, the content here is so well crafted that I feel obligated to recommend 'The witch' to all possible viewers.There are so very few horror films that are this compelling.Wouldst thou like to live deliciously?Why, yes. Yes, I surely would.

title: Come hither
review: Very difficult to understand and honestly not very interesting.. I realize people have different tastes, but I'm Surprised anybody would think this was a masterpiece! Good ideas put out there, but they never actually spark.

title: - It's good, it's suspense and drama as well as terror.
review:
It is not a film that scares the public, it is a history film that makes everyone uncomfortable. The film is almost a complete horror, but it is the discomfort it leaves in the air that sums up the film. The silence and the soundtrack bring a certain tension to the film in the midst of such discomfort, in addition to the cuts ending it with a flourish.
The tension and the gloom was what caught my attention the most, even though the discomfort stands out among them because it was added in exaggerated doses. I was also open-mouthed with the performance of the actors, especially with the performance of the younger actors, it is surprising to see this in young people, there is not much of it these days.
I thought the proposal for the image of a witch that was delivered to us and sorcery was incredible, even though we saw little of it during the film, this image proposal is good and at the same time it is traditional and versatile in the director's way, in addition to being obscure , that most of the time the directors look for obscurity and only deliver clichés, something superficial and the opposite of what is really obscure. In short, it is a good film among other good ones, but not as spectacular as a few. It is not a typical terror, it is not what is expected of a terror, but we can call it terror as we can call suspense and family drama as well.

title: Don't waste your time
review: I don't know what I was expecting but this is one of the most boring films I've ever seen. Don't waste an hour and a half of your life

title: THE OMINOUS MALEVOLENT WITCH
review: Knowing that this is an A24 horror film, it usually has more creepy vibe rather than scary which I also like. The movie really portraits the said era. After the best Hereditary film, this comes after. Anya Taylor-Joy really is the best at horror films from her young age. She starts the film with being innocent and naive until she became omnipotent and that's a good character development since she is "The Witch". I knew the Queen's Gambit girl is the best at horror films. The movie is totally creepy and will leave you having goosebumps until the end. It totally depicts a girl going through maturity and comprehends that she'll eventually experience such chaos in her family. A really good movie to originate a folktale. The only criticism I personally have is how they talk, I sometimes cannot understand their conversation or is it just my perception that is low and besides it's from New England. Overall, there are certain parts that needs to augmentate but it's a 2015 film so, it may be the best!!!

title: WORST "HORROR" MOVIE EVER!
review: The horror is that this movie was made at all and wasted the time of anyone unfortunate enough to view. Beware The V V ITCHThe joke is on the audience because the titular character appears for two seconds at the very end.We can nap for free. Don't bother.

title: A true Witch film
review: The Witch is a dark and gritty take on traditional folklore that modern audiences are not familiar with nowadays. probably one of the best depiction of a witch. They are not beings in flashy colorful costumes and flashy spells. Witches are dark sadistic greedy creatures who affect the lands around them,the wildlife around them and the people around them.they use dark rituals and blood sacrifices . Those characteristics and attributes are shown in this film well. A family of extreme Puritans banish from their town for their extreme ways offers a perfect cast to fall victim to. With a heavy tone on religious themes shows concept of good over evil or evil over good? The movie has a slow paced atmosphere that helps fills the scenes with suspense& tension There's an absence of color in much in the film that Adds a sense of deprived life in these woods. The witch is a film that keeps it's audience of suspense and disbelief drawing you in and on Edge wondering what will the outcome for this Family be in the end.

title: Dirty, disturbing and yet boring movie
review: So first of all I'd like to say that this movie is definitely under the top 3 of the movies that left me feeling dirty afterwards. Watching everything unfold just feels deeply disturbing, so if you are into disturbing horror movies which aren't actually horror movies but yet wanna call themselves that, this movie is for you. I feel like movies like these should have their own genre, well actually they do, psychological thrillers, but even that is a little wishy washy. So the plot is incredibly boring and I just waited for something to happen for the entirety of the movie. The girls parents accuse her of being a witch while she isn't a witch, at the end she actually turns into a witch. Bravo. It is full of biblical references and Christianity and blabla. At the end I couldn't decide what I felt more, bored, disappointed or dirty.

title: The Shining in 1630
review: This folktale is based on literature, trials and documentations from darker times. You should not expect your average horror story when tuning into the debut of director Robert Eggers. He managed to compose a nice blend of thriller, suspense and a certain aesthetic. The sparse soundtrack emerges where necessary. The film was shot with mostly natural light and this makes the setting even more authentic. I am amazed how this movie could be shot in less than 30 days, considering the animals and little children involved.I have to admit, the singing of the kids and the constant crying of the woman is annyoing, but how else would you be dragged into this downward spiral of wickedness? As the story moves on boldly we witness the psychological terror that affects every family member in a different way. While the mother isolates herself in grieving the father tries to put reason or religion in the fatal happenings. Only the oldest daughter Thomasin manages to keep something like a clear head. When in fact she is the one in question.The length is perfect, the pacing great and the ending even surprised me. Give this film a try and watch it from different perspectives. If you focus specifically on acting, or the camera work you will notice many details, that drag you even further in the scene.

title: The Best Wicked Witch Movie So Far
review: To be honest, I am not a big fan of witch-themed movie, but I have watched a few, and none of them is as good as The VVitch. Its style is not quite as usual as other horror movie, making the movie unique. Brilliantly eerie scenography and cinematography create a thrilling and suspensing ambience. The conflict within a family and between their religious belief, society, the wild, also The Satan and Witch cleverness, transcends any other witch movie in my opinion. Another plus point, as the movie goes, you will keep guessing how the story will end, and that's what will keep you focus till the end of it.

title: A bipolar feeling of this film
review: I watched it a few years ago. Had to fast-forward the whole film coz I could barely stand for longer than 10 minutes. The pace was damn too slow! I gave it 1 star at the most.But this time, tonight, somehow I decided to use my best earbuds and tried immersing myself into its atmosphere. For 15 minutes, I told myself. And with the well-balanced sound effect, I finally enjoyed the whole film non-stop. I could totally feel the horror of witchcraft on a cursed farmland. How they struggled with their religious belief and how they encountered the horror are the main themes that give me a synergy of breathlessness.So, even I myself have such 2 bipolar responses to the film. Hence I can understand why the comments here are also bipolar as well. Your mood and audio setups really certainly very, very significant.If I have anything to criticise, that would be the accent they spoke. Oh gosh I found it quite hard to my ears!
This might be my least favorite movie of all time. The only thing slower than this movie is my 90 year old grandma driving on the freeway.

title: True fear all around
review: New England, 1630: a family, away from society, faces the forces of darkness, black magic and constant fear.A horror film that should be the standard for the genre, not "1 in 1000", as it turns out.The atmosphere created since the beginning leads the viewer to question the actions and motives of the characters, the narrative begins with doubts about their past, which forces the viewer to be alert to every detail, in order to try to understand what's going on in this weird family.The main factor is the psychological terror, based on religious fanaticism, typical of that time, and also on paranoia and tension accumulated between people who live inside a bubble, which in this case is not about comfort, but fear.The film takes various bits from various tales of supernatural folklore, and assembles a very interesting set.

title: One of the worst, ever
review: An incredibly terrible snore-fest. The slowest 90 minutes or so you could ever sit through...

title: A great movie with poor execution
review: This movie was deep, it's a story about how a demon can fool you to do sin and fall into darkness even you are a religious person. Interesting right?What's good,Cinematography was great, beautiful film with good actors too, especially the older son, he is great, but for me the main actor just average.What's bad,Many plot holes and some illogical moments/scripts. As example, they said they were running out of food, but i saw an animals that can be eaten just infront of their house. The worse part in this movie was most every moments inside look flat with no intensity. I can't find a scary/creepy part in this movie. Should have done better then this

title: Good Atmosphere
review:
The actors and the cinematography are very good. The movie feels authentic.
The story has very good potential. The angle worked by the director is good.
It is a story about a family unable to fit in.
It is a time of puritanism.
They are basically expelled from the village, due to religious problems, so they move to a place near a big, primordial forest.
They cannot take it. Slowly, they lose their faith, and the mistrust and violence begin. Their descent into despair is very well filmed.
At the end, the supernatural twist is not bad, but it does not feel very genuine. It lacks something. Nevertheless, it is worthy of consideration.
I liked the movie. There is a lot of violence, be warned.
Also, the movie is not good if you are hard of hearing. It is better to have the subtitles on.
The movie deals with many things. You find religion and superstition, survival, fear, tenderness, repression, etc. It also has some fascination for " the powers of darkness".
People out there calling it a masterpiece are perhaps a bit overenthusiastic.
Nevertheless, it is a pretty good movie, much better than the average Hollywood flick.

title: Love it or Hate it.
review: The potential for this movie was amazing. The cinematography was good, the sound was good and even the acting wasn't THAT bad. Slow burner? someone forgot to light the gas on this one. The actual script itself consisted mainly of shouting and arguing that became rather annoying after a short while and reciting of prayers.The writer had many many opportunities to expand on certain elements of the movie to add suspense and to build the mood, however, seems to have been concentrating more on being historically accurate with speech and scenery than actually making the story remotely interesting. There were maybe 3 scenes where the witch made a very short appearance... I'm talking seconds, not even minutes. The film was more about religious paranoia than a witch and even then, the paranoia was mainly towards the end. Before that, it only really showed as constant bickering and shouting.The ending... oh wow... all I will say on that is "facepalm!".

title: Wish more horror movies were like this
review: I admit that I am a history aficionado, but I went into this with a bit of skepticism. Just when I was becoming convinced the horror industry could not produce anything worthwhile, I came across this, and totally loved it.This is a Puritan style horror tale, rife with the dialogue and mindsets of the 17th Century. I did have to use the subtitles to catch all of the dialogue, but the atmosphere is just perfect. The spooky setting of the isolated family, beset with supernatural plagues, the cinematography and the acting crafted a superb film. Psychological horror, superstition and the dread of the unknown play out within each frame of this film, as it leads us to its surprising conclusion.Probably the best film of 2015. Will probably become an annual Halloween viewing for me.

title: 6.9/10? hell no.
review: This is a rare trash, is not worth more than three or four over ten

title: Fine study of witchcraft folklore behind this movie
review: Part of the movie is fantasy, but some of the really weird stuff is indeed based on witch trials, legends of the horned god - and some of the conjurations are in fact quotations from the socalled Grimoires. Of course part of what we see is a bit exaggerated. But the tale is not far from the European traditions of witchcraft. I'm pretty sure that W.B. Yeats and Aleister Crowley would have enjoyed this movie. But alas, they are shadows of the past ...

title: It is extremely hard for a movie to make me feel scared, this movie did it perfectly
review: How can i explain this piece? This movie seems like it is legitimately haunted, it feels as if i am watching a real tragedy unfold right there on my screen, i felt dirty after watching it, the movie's atmosphere makes you feel disturbed at every minute, and that is why it is so captivatingYou see, i love the sensation of being scared, unfortunately, it is not something i can achieve easily with movies nowadays, but this one made it different, they made so the threat on the movie was a real threat to the people of that age, which makes the movie even more scary, all the tones, the dialogues, the acting, the enviroment, everything contributes to this creepy uneasy feeling, and i love it, if you like horror movies, you will love this, watch it, but it's not for the faint of heart

title: A good movie with underused potential
review: (+) the atmosphere is well built and we really feel oursleves immersed into this old pious world thanks to the use of old english(+) no jump scares, the tension builds up naturally(-) a bit disappointing to see the witch at the beginning, a good part of the mystery is spoiled(-) elements could have been more developped, such as the odd connection between the twins and the goat, from which we only get some hints, or the hardship of a family who has to forget its homeland, that is mentioned once by the mother(-) I did not like the ending, it would have been enough if the movie just ended when Thomasin ends up alone, and we don't even know what happened to the twins

title: OMG just go do ANYTHING else than watch this
review:
I wish I had those two hours back!
I kept hoping for some store arc or resolution or ANYTHING. Or the credits. Finally they came. What a waste of time.
¯\_(;/)_/¯

title: In my top ten
review: If you are looking for modern bloody teen slasher movies that are pretty much all the same then don't bother with this. This has a much darker gothic feeling and not at all action packed but geniously put together and acted. I think the best way I can explain it is, I was bought up in a Christian household but think of myself as agnostic, this made me want to go to church and beg for forgiveness.

title: Glad i ignored the 1 star reviews
review: I rarely leave a review but i read so many negative opinions saying it's boring that i felt that i had to. I'm guessing those people never watched a truly boring movie because "The witch" is far from being one.Not recommended to Fast&Furios fans.

title: Scroll down for the low reviews
review:
I dont even know where to start here. If you took the effort to scroll past the 9's and 10's, you can find a lot of people who -like me- feel robbed of their time. I didn't even like the acting, writing or suspense. Thinking about it, I dont think the actors did believe in the script. Oh wait, I have to give one very very big credit. To the child actor playing Caleb. HE WAS GOOD!!! kudos to you. That one scene....
Anyway, I hate to write bad reviews but I feel a warning should be in place here for people who hate bad endings. It was not bad though.... it was insultingly nonsensical.

title: I didn't get it
review: It had its moments but overall I didn't get it and I got bored in the middle. I'm not exactly sure what happened sometimes and the whole thing was slightly frustrating.

title: Worst movie I ever seen in my life
review:
I know many critics give high star and use those word I never heard in my whole life. But this movie is not even a 1 sacry jump scene. We don't know why there family outside the town. I love some nature scene and dark themes but movie is so so so boring if u are horror movie fan and want to watch scary movie then don't even think about this movie. I watched this movie and wait and wait there is a scary moment but the movie end not even 1 scary jump scene came. Acting is perfect.
Everyone give there 100% but there is no story in movie and till the end you don't know what Director want to show us.
I watched worst movie of my life.
I am not a professional critics but i know what is mu taste

title: This movie made me feel bad spirituality speaking
review: This movie made me feel bad spirituality speaking.

title: A great experience, with horror as desert
review: Great cinematography, great acting, great music, great pacing and last but certainly not least. Great horror. With nearly every scene you can see the thought put into framing, lighting and blocking of the scenes. Anya Taylor-Joy, Ralph Ineson and Harvey Scrimshaw each deliver great performances in which you feel every emotion the characters feel. Anger, anguish, wrath, pain, sorrow are all portrayed in the most intimate way imaginable. The score to this movie builds intensity that can only be matched by the likes of Dunkirk. Silence builds a great contrast to this. The horror is decent, but people who are not so fond of nudity might be a little put off by the amount of it.Yet another movie that I recommend watching. This should also be enjoyable for people who are not into horror.

title: Brooding and moody
review: Brilliant. Loved every tension filled minute.Avoid if you like the modern, slasher, jump cut style of movie making on offer these days. This builds much slower and earns it's ending.

title: Film making lives!
review: It's seldom to see a film these days that tells a clearly deliniated story, brings together an ensemble of actors of equal caliber and demonstrates how the collective effort of making that film results in an effort that will stand the test of time. If the topic interests you, make the effort to see this. It will not disappoint.

title: Brilliant movie
review: You know a movie is brilliant when it lacks splatter and silly jump scares but still manages to make you feel uncomfortable, uneasy, worried and scared.I thoroughly enjoyed my time watching it.Give it a shot,

title: Somewhere between science and folklore there is another World
review:
I'm a huge fan of horror! The exorcist, Hereditary - small movies and those small gems that are not Hollywood.A friend of mine (who is digging witchcraft) recommended me this movie some years ago.So with no expectations I watched. And I'm that impressed.The idea is that nature itself and witchcraft are one and the same - the story starts promising with an omnious happening.From there on we see a family slowly being torn apart and from there on its downhill, with a finale I found - well, i don't know.The technical side of it is too notch. The cinematography is splendor and settles with a moody New England and folklore vibe that is perfect.
The acting. The two small children a genuinely creepy and one can't stop wondering. Yeah, it's derailing the main point of the central character. The mother stands out though! She is a hard mother to love and the acting is downright sublime. She steals every scene she is in. What is less than good is the father that from beginning to end had me cringe - it's too much and some might argue otherwise... But when it annoys you through the film, well then it kinda destroys it. This surely has to do with the material. Narrative is important as a minimum and a huge amount of time goes talking to god, the way they did back then. The movie is littered with these sequences, and while it might make it feel more authentic - it detracts in some key moments from the shear terror this family is experiencing.Who is God and who is Satan? Well, nature is a tough companion, it depends on when and where you were born. That's probably the best interpretation I can think of. When rabbits go insane and goats are Lucifer then we all know the time and age.To be fair with this movie, since others are praising it - I would strongly suggest people comparing this with a movie contender like The Others.So a 5 star rating is for a movie somewhere in the middle. Not bad, not goodBut then again, if you're into witchcraft it nails it, I guess.

title: A Film for Film's Sake
review:
Calling The Witch a horror movie is somewhat misleading. Fan of thrillers? - It's a good movie. Fan of Dark Mysteries? - It's a good movie. Fan or horror? It's a good movie. Fan of Historical movies? Hell it might even make you happy too.This movie takes the story of fear, paranoia, and the fear of God not to the extreme, but to what people at the time truly believed. The slow burning tension is masterfully created not only by the combination of the acting, the cinematography, and the writing. Even the subtle score is well put together and not over the time, not brewing up to cheap jump scares or slashing moments.
I myself am a fan of horror, however most horror movies often leave me feeling unfulfilled and unsatisfied. For those who feel this way on an even more dissatisfied level, this movie may be the one that brings the genre of Horror to a level playing field for your interests.Watch The Witch, but with expectations of it being a movie. Not a horror movie or a thriller or whatever genre bending semantic you may want to use, just go into it with an open mind and expect what you would watching anything that wasn't horror. Watch the characters think critically and problem solve, thrust themselves into new situations as the mystery unfolds of a fear birthed lore.

title: One of the best horror movies of the 2010s
review: The first time I saw The Witch, I didn't know what to think. Upon rewatch and letting the film sit, I have grown to love it. Great acting, cinematography that captures the tone and setting perfectly, genuinely smart scares that don't rely on cheap jump scares and a haunting musical score. The Witch is one of A24's best movies and one of the best horror films in the past ten years.Taking place in 1630s New England, a family exiled from their Puritan community move away and build a farmstead beside these woods but not long after they arrive, strange things start happening and that's all I'll say.The best thing about the film is the look. The cinematography and lighting is fantastic as it perfectly captures the look and feel of the situation and tone the characters are in. The craziest thing about this is that the lighting was natural which makes the movie surprisingly more creepy.The one thing that makes the film creepy for me is the music. It's superb. I remember watching the trailer for this movie back when it first came out and that music really sold me on watching the movie. I get chills everytime I watch that trailer. And the music in the trailer is in the movie and it's used so well in the movie. It really sells me on the creepiness of it.Overall, The Witch is phenomenal. It's creepy, engaging from start to finish, has great acting and surprising rewatch value. The only real flaw with the film is the ending, I feel like it could've been better. Other than that, the movie is outstanding and definitely worth watching.

title: Disaster
review: The movie is really terrible!!!! A 90minuzes wasnt, the worst movie i have seen in 2021 so far.

title: Good finale

title: A vvell-done movie
review:
This film doesn't rely on cheap jump scares to deliver its scares. The form of horror this film gives you is by taking you in the world of the characters - rather one character in particular - and the terror that gradually leads to the climax of the story. The bonds between the family members are pushed to the limit as they grow increasingly desperate and some become antagonistic to one another, charging each scene with a sense of profound unease, so you're never certain of what will happen next. That is the masterstroke of the film, the continual slow-burn tension and uncertainty that will keep the viewer disoriented and searching for concrete answers. The film pivots on metaphors, symbolism, period specific dialogue, and character choices to convey a representation of the biblical stories it centers around. Technically, this film is mind blowing; Production design successfully creates a sinister environment that reeks of evil, and the peripherals of the isolated surroundings only add more creepiness to the whole setting. The gorgeously looming and oppressively atmospheric cinematography, as well as the sweeping and dreary score, that often imitates what is happening on the screen, building tension to a crescendo that adds to the horror of this film. In terms of the performance, the ensemble cast does a fantastic job.
Overall, While I do understand the themes, ambiguity, and purpose behind this movie I didn't really find it that interesting or scary for that matter. The reason why critics and audience are so divisive on this film is the same reason why critics and audience are divisive on "Hereditary" - they are both are a slowburn horror films that depend on creepy atmosphere, exploiting tension and unsettling imagery to delivers their scares. People don't mostly appreciate that type of horror, just like me to some extent but you still got to appreciate as they're real work of art.

title: An excellent, moody slow-burn horror film
review: The Witch is a horror film directed by Robert Eggers, starring Anya Taylor-Joy, Ralph Ineson, and Kate Dickie. It follows an American Puritan family in the 1630s living in exile at the edge of a nearby forest as they are tormented by hostile otherworldly forces.Firstly, the acting. Anya Taylor-Joy's performance as Thomasin, eldest daughter of the family, is wonderfully intense and sincere in displaying the hardships of the life of a young Puritan girl, especially one whose role in the family is so thankless and ignored. Throughout the film, she tries to win her mother's approval and dutifully support her family, but is instead repeatedly used as a scapegoat for much of the family's woes. Ralph Ineson plays gruff but well-meaning father William, and Kate Dickie plays distant mother Katherine. Every character feels real, no doubt helped by the authentic dialogue accurate to the time period, which must have been difficult to remember and was painstakingly researched by the production team.Secondly, the atmosphere. The whole film has a constant air of tragedy and sadness, and even in scenes where there is nothing overtly scary happening, the viewer will be on the edge of their seat, expecting something horrible to happen, but no. The tension builds and builds. Over the course of the film, the bonds between the family members are pushed to the limit as they grow increasingly desperate and some become hostile to one another, charging each scene with a sense of profound unease, so you're never certain of what will happen next. That is the masterstroke of the film, the continual "slow-burn" tension and uncertainty that will keep audiences disoriented and searching for concrete answers.The film, aside from being a horror film focused largely on exploiting tension and unsettling imagery, is also an excellent demonstration of how harsh the average Puritan family's life was at the time, out in the wilderness without support, and how quickly a family can succumb to paranoia thanks to stress and tragedy. Thanks to the mixture of more mundane family drama and gripping terror, there are many ways to interpret the film's events, and I am glad that the film allows for that flexibility since I feel that horror, with its basis in creating fear, should let audiences draw on their own fears and experiences while watching.In conclusion, the film is an excellent "slow-burn" horror film, with masterful performances, a great mood and atmosphere, and the benefit of being vague enough to allow for multiple interpretations.Score: 10/10

title: Historic
review:
I am a fan of 17th century New England history.This film has some serious creds when it comes to historic accuracy. It is well filmed,cast and written!It is a film you need to watch twice to let the finer points sink in.
It delves a lot into religion , dogma,social pressure,feminism,arbitrary power, conventionality, history, sexual desire, gender roles, the wilderness, and family interaction. Some of these reflect a period orientation,others are,more,modern facets.
Most of movie reflects the thinking of the time period. Christian fundamental ideas. The Devil was a given in their lives. Most people today doubt the devil exists ,doubt god exists, doubt witchs, the devils minions exist. The real evil in this movie is within this family,because of their beliefs.
The wilderness beyond civilization plays a big part in this movie. Exile, freedom, beyond convention, liberation, challenge, solitude, isolation, a howling wilderness filled with wild beasts and wild men.
This is not a fast paced movie. It is more a thinkers movie.The pacing is slow and the problems mount slowly. Without the support of community , they cannot deal with the familys internal issues.
The only flaw I saw for the time period, was the horse.Farm power in those days,early -mid 1600's in New England ,was ox powered.
The only Indians in this movie are seen when the family is exiled from the settlement. The Indians are welcome in the town ,but the family is,not.

title: Robert Eggers knows his craft well!
review:
Robert Eggers' directorial debut "The Witch" is eccentric with its discrete ipseity. It corresponds to historical folklores in an aphotic, grotesque manner. Using creepy elements; it engulfs you through its aptly created ambiance & the very sense of desolation!
Obtaining its nuances from traditional lore, mythical legends; The film displays the horrifying events manifest upon an alienated family residing out in the wilderness. Bewitched by an evil presence deep into the woods, a series of mischievous events follow through.Technically it is affluent with conspicuous Cinematography coupled with unsettling set of imagery that will surely make you feel distressed. A haunting piece of a soundscore, thrivingly preserving an eerie & appalling atmosphere throughout the entirety. Storywise it just falls short in providing enough rationale about the erratic events that take place, but the Screenplay has been unmarred from any of those demerits.Playing the eldest daughter, Anya Taylor-Joy is the scene-stealer here! Enacting the role of an agitated teenager; she elegantly outshined everyone else. With those broad, sparkling eyes; she uttered remorse, agony & malice to the best of her ability. Ralph Ineson and Kate Dickie as the susceptible parents were simply astonishing.
The same impression applies to the other child actors as well!All things considered, this has been a bodacious affair. There was certainly a yearn for further elucidation regarding some of the story points; yet needless to say, I dig its stylized execution and the specific way it's been laid out.With only two feature films so far, Robert Eggers made quite an impression; making it to the list of my go-to directors with such ease.

title: Metaphor for delusion and obsession in 2021
review: Prescient work that illuminates the result of obsessive beliefs and the conclusion of ill-founded explanations for mis-fortune.

title: Historic superstition come to life
review:
Image a family from England 400 years ago in the American wilderness. This is a wonderfully realised portrayal of such a family. A pious family with all the superstitions that people used to believe in.
The beginning is beautiful and the ambiance is chilling and enticing, but I didn't really grow to love the characters and to me their actions didn't always feel right. The fantasy elements of the story worked cinematically but not as a story and there we get to the heart of the problem: there isn't really any character development. All the actors do a fine job, but it still falls rather flat in the end.

title: Seems authentic and eerie
review: This was a very very good movie. The acting is superb and the old language used adds to the authenticity of it.So so tired of movies set in times hundreds of years ago where women have beautifully coiffed hair, men swear and use slang that would never have been used, people have straight white teeth, and they kiss with open mouths. No! In the 1600s these were God-fearing people who would never swear as it would be a blasphemy. They never revealed any promiscuity for fear of being stricken down. Plain folks worked and little else. We have learned our lessons but men were considered superior and that's just the way it was.On top of this it was a good story with several layers to analyze. One of my favourite movies in the last few years.

title: Worst movie ever, of dystopian Christian horror, bleak and weak
review:
Dystopian Christian horror.
It isn't a horror film but the imagination of an evil downward spiral tearing a family apart that is trying their best to cling on to their own failing Christian sentiments, beliefs and faith as theirs absolutely nothing else left as they perceive themselves now as outcasts, due to a matter of some unexplained or largely unacknowledged principles while these beliefs are failing miserably, as the film does with it.
Anything bad that is happening to them is irrationally identified as being evil based on belief and not on what's shown or explained within the context of the movie but by a lecture of Christian dogmatic belief throughout. That's ultimately the basis of this film, Christian culture dramatised as perceived of being this period, with ideas of witchcraft thrown in to explain and justify their own misery, they effectively create the cause for cursing themselves and being at war with themselves. While using the oldest daughter as a vehicle to dump all their hate and anger and then have the audacity and ignorance to call her evil and not see this as being the very evil they have created by their own actions.
This is really the only thing I had taken away from the movie but it will undoubtedly be lost and of little interest to many people as it's not the movie we came to see, nor did we expect a philosophical tale of understanding and if we did, we'd want at least a good movie with it to get this point across.
I'd seriously have to call into question the legitimacy of the high ratings of this movie.
I watched it wanted to like it and wanting so much for something to just happen but it just doesn't, this movie should come massively under the category of misadvertised and be enough to disappoint the audience on that basis alone. It's like walking into an action movie that turns out to be a musical.
It's just a boring bleak film. It's acted well but it's also a terrible story or the lack of a story that makes this so bad that makes you want to slit your wrists, especially if you've clung on for dear life hoping that at some point a story will come together but it never does. It's a shambles of a movie and has a very limited audience at best which is probably why it had been missold originally to target a wider audience it doesn't deserve.
You'd only watch this movie to see just how bad it actually is and probably out of disbelief that so many people must have taken tranquillisers or a knock to their head before watching and reviewing this or are cunningly trying to entice you to go through the same agony they've just experienced, as misery loves company and they want you to suffer it if they had to do so. Just don't watch it if you're expecting a horror, mystery or anything intriguing of the supernatural, occult or want a suspenseful experience of any kind other than a period drama that exists alongside music that should accompany a horror movie. If you're silly enough to believe the main purpose of this movie will be focusing on a witch or witchcraft don't watch this movie you'll be massively disappointed and letdown.

title: Establishes a real, convincing sense of dread and impending horror. Too bad the ending is fumbled.
review: THE WITCH is a tough movie to dislike, even as it is a tough movie to get through. It suffers from the curse of many otherwise good horror movies (such as IT FOLLOWS)...the ending stinks. Frankly, it does seem tough to find good endings to supernatural stories...once you see the horror before you, it somehow becomes less than the dread building up to it. Good horror movies and bad horror movies often suffer from it. It's a "short story" problem. By this, I mean...think about some of the great short stories you've read in your life. Many of them end with abrupt, surprise endings (OCCURRENCE ON OWL CREEK BRIDGE) or perhaps just sort of end (50% of modern day short stories). So you've invested 20 minutes of your time in a just so-so story. Or maybe the surprise ending is abrupt, but it's fun given how little of your time you've given up. You enjoyed the prose, and then the ending wasn't too great...but overall, you're content with the time you spent. NOW, turn that around....you've spend $20+ dollars for the pair of movie tickets. Maybe you bought snacks. You sat in the dark for 90+ minutes. And for 88 minutes, you were having a pretty good time, then suddenly the movie ends. BLAIR WITCH, THE LAST EXORCISM, etc. etc. NOW you feel cheated and disappointed. And for me, THE WITCH fell into this trap, and for that it should get a 2 star rating, perhaps.But, the building of atmosphere and dread is top notch. Some truly creepy and disturbing things happen. The movie is set in puritanical times, and follows a family that is SO puritanical, that they've been kicked out of town!! Dad is the fanatic, and of course his wife and children follow along. They build a house and homestead near a forest, and almost immediately, weird stuff starts to happen. I won't describe it all, but much involves animals and VERY creepy younger siblings. The story is told mostly through the eyes of the oldest daughter, a girl on the edge of "womanhood" (to use a somewhat icky cliche). I put it this way, because her own father mistrusts his daughter when he sees she's growing up. He believes we are all sinful, and women especially are not to be trusted. So when bad things start happening, who does he blame first? Anyway, the atmosphere is awesomely done, and the acting is really top notch. These are fairly inexperienced performers, but they do very, very well. And when all hell finally starts to break loose, you feel pretty bad for some of the things that start happening to these people...as alien and extreme as they may seem.And really, the entire setting and time of the film is well done. I felt that the details of everyday life, the set and costume design, etc. was all really excellent. Low budget, but never cheap. Cinematography was good. The minimal special effects were good. Only the sound mix seemed off...but I can't say if that was the theater's fault or the film. But sometimes I had a hard time understanding everyone. But I really appreciated the feeling of immersion, not just in a creepy atmosphere but into a world that felt real yet unfamiliar. This was an extra touch that really made me respond to the film. I give it four stars, but would hesitate to recommend to anyone. It's slow moving (VERY) and it disappoints with its ending. For me, the other parts of the film overcame all that. But I can EASILY see that this would not be the case for other viewers. I will probably watch it again after the blu-ray is released...but I bet I'll watch it alone.
